meanings.definition: A political ideology characterized by extreme traditionalism and opposition to change.
meanings.sent1: Ultraconservatism can be seen in the strong resistance to any new ideas or reforms.
meanings.sent2: The country's leaders were known for their adherence to ultraconservatism, refusing to consider any modern policies.
meanings.sent3: At the ultraconservatism club meeting, they joked that even the idea of using smartphones was too progressive.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a fortress of ultraconservatism, impervious to the winds of change.
meanings.sent5: The roots of ultraconservatism run deep, anchoring society in the past.

meanings.definition: The beliefs and practices associated with extreme conservatism.
meanings.sent1: In their family, ultraconservatism meant following strict traditions without question.
meanings.sent2: The town's culture was steeped in ultraconservatism, valuing customs from centuries ago.
meanings.sent3: She found herself in a whirlwind of ultraconservatism when she accidentally wore mismatched socks to the formal event.
meanings.sent4: The ultraconservatism of the group was a shield against any hint of progress.
meanings.sent5: The museum showcased the relics of ultraconservatism, frozen in time for all to see.
